title: A.A.R.M
description: Dwight prepares for a marriage proposal and hires an assistant for his assistant, Andy auditions for a singing program, Darryl tries to leave his job without a fuss, and Pam has second thoughts about Jim staying in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: The tea in Nepal is very hot.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: But the coffee in Peru is much hotter. [Erin buzzes him into the office]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Last week I finally became permanent manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton. My first project: increase security. I got these doors from a jewelry store that had recently gone out of business. Now they're protecting America's real treasure, paper. Every morning I email the day's security codes. Something that's been really missing from my life has been writing secret codes. It's not the KGB, but it's a start.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: The tea in Nepal is very hot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But the coffee in Peru is far hotter.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Close.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is Tuesday, right? The coffee in Paraguay is far hotter?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Colder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The coffee in Paraguay is colder?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, I meant you're getting colder. The correct response is, "the coffee in Peru is much hotter."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah, much, ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But, that's three wrong, so I gotta give you the steam. [Dwight begins to protest] Unless you want me to break protocol?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no. Give me the steam.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's just harmless steam to panic intruders. I'd like to get harmful steam, but the prices are absurd.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [while getting steamed] Break protocol! Break protocol! Break protocol!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [carrying in clothes on hangers] Oh, I'm saving a fortune on dry cleaning.

quotes.speaker: Phillip
quotes.text: Mama!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela, someone wants you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ok, coming. Hi, baby.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela's divorce from the senator has been very difficult for her. When she got kicked out of her apartment, I invited her to move in with me. Ironic that it's Angela who's living in the closet. Hey-o.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Saddle shoes. With denim? I will literally call child services.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Go get 'em, honey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, don't worry. They'll get got.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Manager of Dunder Mifflin? Check. Owner of a 1600-acre beet farm? Check. Engaged to be married to an actual milkmaid? Check... on that later today. This is my grandmother's ring. It was made from a bullet I took out of her left buttock. She was a moonshiner shot by Adolph Coors. This is my grandmother's buttock bullet ring.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello, good morning. My name is Andrew Bernard. You might know me from a TV documentary that's premiering tonight. I also killed it in local theater and I am fresh off of a hot industrial flick.

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: Ok, thanks. Go ahead and get in the back of the line.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, burned all my bridges at Dunder Mifflin, and time to become the next American Idol. By winning America's Next A Cappella Sensation. On channel TBD. It's a really cool show, it's like a revision of the whole American Idol, Voice, Sing-Off phenomenon. On this show, all three judges are mean!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sales form for you to sign.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what to do. [waits for Jim to put form in inbox, signs it and returns it to outbox] Ok

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Behind every great regional manager is a great assistant to the regional manager, and I have chosen one of the best.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aw, thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Once upon a time we were natural enemies, but we've overcome our differences. Much like Germany and Italy in World War--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good call. Together we run a no-nonsense office.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pre-conference room meeting with Dwight went really well.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, bodes well for the post-conference room meeting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All depends on the conference room meeting itself. [phone chimes] Uh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is that them again?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe you should call back?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I will. I will.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The guys at Athlead are still bugging me about this three month roadshow thing. Meeting athletes on their home turf, building relationships. Yeah, it sounds exciting. But I said no, and that's final. I almost lost Pam over this business. I'm not risking that again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When Jim decided to come back to Scranton full-time, I was relieved, but I also feel a little guilty. I mean, he's giving up this big thing for me. But he seems happy. I mean, he's certainly been goofing around a lot. I love goofy Jim.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Welcome.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He welcomes you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Please take an agenda item.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Your agenda-taking pleases him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have a seat, Phyllis. There we go. As you know, I like to begin each day with an inspirational quote. "Some say the only failure there is is the failure to try." [buzzer sound] That is wrong. Failure of any kind is failure. Jim, over to you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's not get crazy and ruin our no-nonsense streak, all right? So, for instance, if you're expecting a fax today, please don't yell out, "Michael J. Fax from Fax to the Future." Ok? That's nonsense.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Question.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, beautiful girl in the front.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We are expecting a water delivery today at 10am. What if, as they're delivering the water jugs, someone screams out, "Nice jugs"?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's obviously nonsense. Nonsense. And what percentage of nonsense do we tolerate in this office?

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: [overlapping] Zero. No nonsense. You can't have nonsense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as Angela enters with Phillip] What is going on?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Daycare won't take Phillip anymore.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Apparently my station in life has descended to a depth even they won't forgive. So, hi.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hi, buddy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok. Um, new agenda item. Phillip will be joining us in the office today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Gotta write that down. Ok, big day today. Airing of the documentary. Who's excited?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'd better come out of this smelling like a rose. I've been on my best behavior for nine years. If it wasn't for the cameras, I would've done some truly vulgar crap.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Over the course of this documentary I've had three affairs. If you find my body in a ditch, let me save the police some trouble: my wife did it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm letting you all off half an hour early to view the documentary. So you can make it up to me by working an extra half an hour tomorrow, or a minute extra for the rest of the month.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Ooh, announcement! Some of us whose televisions got broken during an all-you-can-eat shrimp commercial will be watching tonight at Poor Richard's. But note, all are welcome, not just those whose saw an all-you-can-eat shrimp commercial and charged their televisions.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I can't believe the doc is finally going to air. When this thing started, I was still having sex with women. As was Kevin, I believe.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: This airs tonight? Oh my god. If my parents see this, I am toast.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is really huge. This is like the March on Washington but for a singing show. Can you imagine if Martin Luther King were here? And sang "I Dreamed a Dream" from Les Mis? With that baritone? That would be historic.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Whoo-hoo! Casey Dean! Cincinnati, Ohio! [singing] Doctor, doctor, gimme the news, I got a great Casey Dean for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: America wants it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, this is my time! You don't belt on my time! I belt on my time.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: [singing] Casey Dean!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [vocalizing over her] Casey Dean!

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Man, those are some nice pipes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: What's your name?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Andy. What's yours?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why didn't you pack the apple snacks?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why didn't you pack the apple snacks?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Guys.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Because whenever I pack the bag, you say I do it wrong.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Guys.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why don't you pack it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Guys.

quotes.speaker: {Angela} & {Oscar}
quotes.text: Kevin, what?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Do you want to see a video of a weatherman who says "bold front" instead of "cold front"? It's insane.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Not now, Kevin. Can't you see we're busy? Phillip needs his apple snacks.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Seriously, Kevin. I'm just gonna have to go to the store.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ok, you go to the store.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Philllip, Phillip, Phillip. It's all about Phillip. I hate Phillip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not now! Private time!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I love Star Wars as much as the next guy--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, hey! Seriously? [holds up Battlestar Galactica model box]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My god, I'm so sorry. Well this might make up for it: I think I have found an enormous source of overlooked PFN.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which is, of course...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Potential future nonsense.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, good abbreviating, Jim. That saved some time. Now, hurry up, shut the door. Break it down for me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna need you to look at your hierarchy mobile. You've got a regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The power source.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Obviously, the assistant to the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A loyal, but bungling apostle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: But what about the assistant assistant to the regional manager?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Someone to whisper in the ear of the consigliore.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'd have to get some more wire and string, but it's doable. Do you think any of them out there are capable?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, right. I mean, unless they're willing to pass some tests.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I like the sound of that. Who do you have in mind?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I know this sounds crazy, but how would King Arthur choose the next knight of his round table?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That doesn't sound crazy, Jim. That's the sanest thing I've ever heard.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: What're you listening to?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hmm? Um, uh, locking in my starting note. A 440.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Oh, sweet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: A cappella is all about pitch, and I am nothing if not a total pitch bitch.

quotes.speaker: Mark McGrath
quotes.text: What's up, everybody? And welcome to America's Next A Cappella Singing Sensation!

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Ah! It's Mark McGrath! Oh my god! You're gorgeous!

quotes.speaker: Mark McGrath
quotes.text: Thank you, thank you so much. And thank you for your patience. And we hope to see you guys within the next five to seven hours. Now, just to give you a couple parameters of the show, each of you will sing a song for thirty seconds, after which our judges will decide if they want you in their a cappella group. Now, each group will start with 90 singers, which will compete in a series of singing and physical challenges. Oh, and look out for that pesky mole!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There's a mole?

quotes.speaker: Mark McGrath
quotes.text: Oops. I'm not supposed to--I'm not supposed to say that. All right, no mole. Forget I said it, all right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What mole? What are you talking about? I already forgot about it.

quotes.speaker: Mark McGrath
quotes.text: Good man right there. I'll see you guys inside. Good luck, all right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! Pour some Sugar Ray on me!

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: What? On a roll much?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know where it came from.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: That was amazing, man!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, it felt good. It felt funny.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Yeah, you made a personal connection with him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I did, I felt it.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Big time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you so excited about?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are you up to?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Members of the office, hear ye.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That means ye, Plop!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Plop? Still?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We owe Andy that much. Am I right people?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Today we will be testing candidates for the position of assistant to the assistant to the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Aw, heck ya!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You'll always have the upper hand, when you've got a good a-arm. Trademark pending.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is not an excuse to blow off work doing carnival-like activities. Sure, every participant will be getting a corndog, but that's for fueling only. No savoring.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow, the honor. God, I envy them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He envies you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't need to repeat right now, when I'm saying it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: By 2:00, Dwight will chose himself to be assistant to his own assistant, me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What up?

quotes.speaker: Glenn
quotes.text: What's going on? How was the delivery?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Delivered all my furniture to Philly. Hey, keep it down, though. Nobody knows I'm here.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I hate goodbyes, so last week, when I left Dunder Mifflin for good, I pulled the old Irish Exit. Just slipped out without making a big deal. No hard feelings. No feelings at all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A good assistant knows what their superior is thinking before they even think it. Meredith, what number am I thinking of right now?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Uh, two.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not even close, Meredith. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, Pam. What song is running through my head right now?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Theme song from Saved by the Bell.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, my god! It was the theme song to Boy Meets World.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, no, no, no, stop. Spouses can read each other's minds. You're trying to give your wife this job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's exactly what I was doing. Plop, what animal am I picturing?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: A horse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ew, the exact opposite, actually.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: What's the opposite of a horse?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: {Jim} & {Dwight}
quotes.text: Sea horse.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa. How did you know that I was gonna--

quotes.speaker: {Jim} & {Dwight}
quotes.text: Say that? Uncanny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Challenge number two, protocol. Clark?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Do you want a corn dog?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I would love a corn dog.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We'll see. You are an assistant who's just gotten a phone message. I am in a meeting with Dwight, Robert Dunder, and his niece. Uh-oh, look who came to join us. The Turkish ambassador to Armenia, Yuri Slovak, who, by the way, is extremely embarrassed about the size of his nose. Go ahead and read that phone message.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [reading] Mr. Halpert, your wife called to find out how your meeting with Yuri Big Nose went."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no, no! You don't read it aloud like that! God! Besides, the whole thing is a trick question. There's no Turkish ambassador to Armenia. The two countries don't have diplomatic relations.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uncanny.

quotes.speaker: Soldier
quotes.text: I just hope that if my buddies who are still in Afghanistan see me win, they'll feel like anything is possible.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great, more screen time for the war vet. All you gotta do is risk your life for this country and everyone goes gaga for you.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Over at the porta-potties, they were interviewing a homeless, single mother with three kids.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is this a show about the resiliency of the human spirit? Or is it a show about singing?

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: I don't know. But I'm getting really worried here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Me too. Hold my place in line.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They want feel-good stories? Wait until they get a good feel of me.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thanks, man.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yep. Take care.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Darryl, hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool, are you coming back to say hi?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No, no, I'm not here actually. These donuts are part of my escape from the guys at the warehouse I didn't say goodbye to.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aha. How's Athlead?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We livin' like rock stars. I'm about to eat free steaks with my sports heroes in 32 different cities.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Jim really doesn't want to come?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He says he doesn't want to.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Wow. Man. I hope he doesn't regret it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, he seems really happy being back here at Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Jim is happy here, selling paper at Dunder Mifflin?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's what he says.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: If you say so. Hey, good seeing you. Remember, I was never here. All right, then.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: An assistant brings their boss coffee with speed and dexterity. But an assistant to the assistant has a thousand times more to prove, am I right?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A thousand times more.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'll try this one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Phyllis! Grab both these coffees, double-fist it, and head through this obstacle course.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [grabbing the coffee] Hot!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. It's real. It's the only way you'll learn. OK, and go ahead. [Phyllis carefully makes her way through the obstacle course] Oh, god, nice! She's through the green, everybody. Here comes yellow, real doozy. Careful!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [over Jim] No, no, no! Phyllis, seriously?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look at that form.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [running over and taking the coffee cups from Phyllis] Oh, god, this is pathetic! The boss needs his coffee! [races through obstacles, spilling coffee] Augh! Ah! Here you are, sir! Here's your coffee! Ah, my skin, ow, ow! It burns! Ah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uncanny. [everyone applauds]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Darryl?! Darryl!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, hey. Hey, what's up, y'all?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You left us without saying goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, my bad. Goodbye, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey! No way!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's totally uncool.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Are you kidding? You broke our hearts. Get upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't think I sh-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Get upstairs, mister!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Right. Now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Guess I'm going upstairs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, Dwight, this whole search for the assistant thing--none of these people are good enough.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What I'm about to say makes no logical sense, and yet, it might be the most logical thing I've ever said.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, this is gonna come as no surprise but I know exactly what you are going to say. The only possible assistant to my assistant-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: The new assistant to the assistant to the regional manager is Dwight K. Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes! [weak applause] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you might want to kneel for this. And yet, the manager for Dunder Mifflin kneels for no one. [Dwight awkwardly squats] That's it. You look really, really good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, from now on, anyone who needs to speak to me has got to go through me first, all right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You all right? What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you happy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, I'm happy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I know that you're, like, happy and, like, you had fun today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And that was fun. But what about a year from now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What about five years from now?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because I'm so glad you're back, baby, but I'm just--I was talking to Darryl, and he was talking about the trip, and I just feel like you're giving up so much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This was my decision, not yours.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You didn't force me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I kind of forced you to do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You did not force me to do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, I did.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know how else to tell you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm afraid that you're gonna resent me and I'm afraid that--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Resent you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This is not enough for you and I'm afraid that I'm not enough for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Is that really what you think?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not enough? I don't know how else to explain it to her, so, you know what? I know it's against the rules but I'm gonna need a favor from you guys.

quotes.speaker: Camera Crew
quotes.text: Okay. You got it, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I didn't realize we were this close.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: We're all a little hormonal with the doc airing.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Are you gonna come to Poor Richard's and watch with us tonight?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Uh... yeah. Depending on traffic.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: He ain't coming.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh, god!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: These dudes are definitely in a weird mood. Picked the wrong day to return a truck.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Well, it's been great.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Eleven years. A guy is in your life for 11 years and then he's gone for who knows how long.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Maybe forever. Anyhow--

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Did we ever have lunch together, just--just the two of us? You know what, I'm gonna make reservations right now at Cugino's.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Question for Darryl. Did we ever get loaded and listen to Zeppelin in my van?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, oh, I'm sure we did.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nah, I call one hour van time with Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Darryl, you know, I would love to just record some of your stories, just let the tape roll for six or eight or ten hours and just see what we get.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Listen guys, we can do it all. We just have to divide Darryl's next 12 hours into 90-minute segments. I will go watch an eHow video on how to use Excel, and then we'll get this started.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait a minute. Okay, I made the mistake of sneaking out of here and that's on me. But I'm not gonna spend the rest of the day here doing stuff with you cause you're feeling sentimental.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You have to! [everyone grumbling]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. I'll do one thing with y'all.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Which thing?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't care, choose amongst yourselves. Not the van though.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, you know my name. Well, that is shocking. [continues making noise]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, could you not do that?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What? I'm moving the ink down in my pen, for work.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Here, use my pen.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Don't tell me what to do!

quotes.speaker: {Angela} & {Oscar}
quotes.text: Shhh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, I don't need this! And you obviously don't need me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Kevin, where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Away. Tell Phillip that his stupid little baby wish came true.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He just won't go down. It's as if he's excited by all this paper.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know. Earlier today he tried to eat some of the 24-weight letter bond.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Smart baby. That's the most flavorful bond.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, what's goin' on over here? Some sort of singing competition for the young'uns?

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: You're back!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, it's me, Andy!

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: No, I know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, no, no. I'm wearing makeup.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: You did a really great job. You even look shorter.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, I took out my lifts.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, unlike Andy Bernard, this character is my real height.

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: All day long, it's moo the cows and cluck the hens. Get the sheep baa-ed. Oink the pigs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oink the pigs, that is very important. [watching Phillip]

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Dwight, I'm telling you about all the things that ma said after the horse kicked her in the head. Where are you? Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The way that boy looks at the Galactica is precisely the way I look at the Galactica. And he eats the same kind of paper I do. Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [puts his grandmother's ring away] Thank you, Esther.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight throws "Now" beanie at Jim's head]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You threw the summoning bag at me, sir?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I need you to perform a test.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Perform a test.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On an innocent baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooh, I like where this is going. Unfortunately I have a lot of work today so I'm gonna have to hand this off to my number two. But, don't worry, he's the best in the biz.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn straight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Unless you think he can't handle it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, he can handle it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [holding Phillip] Listen, listen. Shh, buddy. Stanley's sleeping. You don't want to wake up the grumpy old walrus, do you?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I heard that.

quotes.speaker: Phillip
quotes.text: Mama.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, you want me to take the little diaper blaster? Pam can attest, there's no one better at getting brats to shut their yaps.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He does have a gift.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, he's calling for his mom, but, okay, here, here you go. Careful, he bites.

quotes.speaker: Phillip
quotes.text: Mama.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay. [takes Phillip who immediately stops crying] You ever been in a manager's office before?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Phillip, you wanna play a little game? It's called "Schrute or Consequences." You're gonna choose one of these two things. A check for a million dollars, or this dirty old beet. Yuck, pew! Which will it be? Money or the beet?

quotes.speaker: Phillip
quotes.text: Beet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Any ordinary child would have taken the money, but you're no ordinary child are you? No. I can tell by your gorgeous, widely-set eyes.

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: Sorry, folks, the judges are totally swamped. We are all done taking auditions.

quotes.speaker: People in line
quotes.text: Oh come on! Hey!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what?

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: But thanks for coming out and be sure to watch America's Next A Cappella Sensa--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. You can't do that. You can't do that, we've all been waiting.

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am going in there! Don't--

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: No, you're not, sir.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't--don't--

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: Please don't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't touch me.

quotes.speaker: Check-in guy
quotes.text: I'm not touching you. Okay? [Andy makes a break for it]

quotes.speaker: Casey
quotes.text: Run, old man! Run! Run! Run for your life! Get off. Don't you dare. Don't get--I could see it. You were gonna get handsy with me. Not interested. I'm Casey Dean! You'll be seeing the last of me. Er, I meant you won't be seeing the last of me!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey. Did you manage to feed him? I don't know what it is. He just keeps spitting out the nipple.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is because this baby is of superior intelligence. He can tell when he's being tricked out of the experience of a real human breast.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: He's not that smart. He doesn't know where I hid his duck.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [interrupting contestant singing "Beautiful" by Christina Aguilera] Hi. You're still here. Oh, thank god. Clay Aiken, Santigold, Aaron Rodgers. You're like, my three favorite people ever.

quotes.speaker: Santigold
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [shushing contestant] Sweetheart, you're amazing, okay? You're obviously gonna be on the show, so it's someone else's turn now. Yeah, go ahead. All right, [old man voice] my name is Ezra Cornell and I'm just a kindly old fellow with a song in my heart.

quotes.speaker: Aaron Rodgers
quotes.text: No, you're a middle-aged man with a lot of makeup on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Busted. Yes, got it. All right. Tried to get your attention with tricks, but you just want to hear me sing, I respect that.

quotes.speaker: Clay Aiken
quotes.text: No, we do not want to hear you sing.

quotes.speaker: Santigold
quotes.text: Gabriella was our last audition. Thank you. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nope! Can't end like this. Slept in my car last night, quit my job, burned all my bridges. I went to the bathroom on my boss's car. And I did unspeakable things with Carla Fern.

quotes.speaker: Aaron Rodgers
quotes.text: Flag on the play.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's--that's what--yeah. Okay, all right, well, here's the song. [singing] Far above Cayuga's waters, with her waves so blue, stands our noble alma mater--

quotes.speaker: Santigold
quotes.text: What is this song?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you insane? It's the Cornell fight song.

quotes.speaker: Clay Aiken
quotes.text: Listen, all right, thank you very much, we're not interested.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You didn't let me finish. That's not fair.

quotes.speaker: Aaron Rodgers
quotes.text: Look, man, you're not terrible. We've heard a lot of really good singers today and you're just not good enough.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow, you guys are really mean. I guess that's the show. Let me try a different song, okay?

quotes.speaker: Aaron Rodgers
quotes.text: Can he do this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Hey, hobo man, hey, dapper Dan, you both got your style, but, brother, you're never fully dressed without a smile. [falters at the judges' reactions] Yeah. Your clothes may be beau brummelly--

quotes.speaker: Santigold
quotes.text: Look, you gotta go. [Andy falls to his knees, sobbing] You can't just sit here and cry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh I can so just sit here and cry!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [addressing camera after opening envelope on his desk] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, Kev, how you doing, buddy?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Can't hear you. I'm giving you the silence treatment. How does it feel being ignored?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, I guess, it's just that Phillip got you something.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah, a $25 gift card, iTunes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I think there's, like, $7 left.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's just his way of saying, "Thanks for letting me hang out in Accounting."

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Phillip got this for me?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That was a really cool move.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Would you like to hold Phillip? [hands off Phillip] Yeah. That's Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Easy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What a chubbers. Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay, watch it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm losing my balance.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, Kevin, no.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, no.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No horseplay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You wanna play with the cactus?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, no!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So, me and Phillip were just talking and we decided we're gonna be best friends. He's a little standoffish at first. But once he starts buying you things, man, you can tell he likes you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We have our decision.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You chose one thing?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We want to dance with you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You want to dance?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: One dance, all of us together.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This is what you want?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Better get some decent speakers up here then, cause we're gonna do this right.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes! [Stanley, Creed, Meredith and Creed all cheer]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey. You wanted to see me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Door. Chair. It's about Phillip.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I am sorry he's here today but I had--

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I believe that boy may be a Schrute. And if he is, that child needs to be accorded what is his. An enormous farm, an inheritance, and the right to be raised under rigorous Schrute traditions. You will, of course, be compensated with a marriage proposal.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How thoughtful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Then the two of you would move to my 1,600-acre estate, which, let's face it, is a big step up from living in a gay man's closet.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: If he is your son, that's a great plan. But he's not. He's not your son.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very well.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can I go back to my desk now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What is this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well I've been trying to tell you how I feel, and you wouldn't believe me, so [shows her DVD] I needed a little help.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim! I need my assistant to the regional manager. Code red.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, I don't have my pocket code chart on me, right now, so.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [throws "now" beanbag at Jim] Now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I have an assistant now, who can help you with whatever you need. He is lazy, so crack the whip.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim. I'm not kidding. I need you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, um, this is... [leaves DVD with her]--I'll be right back.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What do we got?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I was thinking of proposing to Esther today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! Congratulations, that's a really big step.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She's got a ton of great qualities. She's young, she's beautiful, genes so pure you could lick them. Her family admires me, my family tolerates hers. A lot of them are the same people because we're third cousins, which is great for bloodlines and isn't technically incest.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right in the sweet spot. I think you're gonna be really happy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Plus her dowry contains a walk-in freezer full of frozen, premium cattle sperm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whistles] That's a lot of pros.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And did I mention that she weaves? Colorful, durable blankets and rugs! It all adds up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So what is the problem?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Angela.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam hesitates but puts the DVD into the laptop to watch]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know what you want me to tell you, man. All I know is that every time I've been faced with a tough decision, there's only one thing that outweighs every other concern. One thing that will make you give up on everything you thought you knew, every instinct, every rational calculation.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Some sort of virus?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Love.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam starts the video; title screen reads "Beesly--You think I'll have regrets. I asked the doc crew to help me show you why I won't..."; highlights of Pam and Jim from the documentary play over Snow Patrol's "Open Your Eyes"]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, listen: no matter what happens, you gotta forget about all the other stuff. You gotta forget about logic and fear and doubt. You just gotta do everything you can to get to the one woman who's gonna make all this worth it. At the end of the day, you gotta jump. You love Angela, Dwight. I think you always have.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're a good assistant, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not as good as you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's very true. Get the hell outta here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You got it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You watched it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, then I guess you're ready for this. [gives her the Christmas card]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's from the teapot. Everything you'll ever need to know is in that note. [Pam reads the card] Not enough for me? You are everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ok, everybody ready?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hit it, red! ["Boogie Wonderland" by Earth Wind & Fire plays as Darryl dances with each member of the office]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I wanted to leave quietly. It seemed dignified. But having Kevin grind up on my front while Erin pretends to hump me from behind is a more accurate tribute to my years here. I'm gonna miss these guys.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok, I've got my--

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: See you guys at Poor Richard's, all right?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: All right, Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay, bye.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: See you there.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Bye, Phillip. High five.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yay! I am gonna drop Phillip off at my mother's, and I'll meet you at Poor Richard's in an hour.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Are you sure you don't want me to drop him off?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She doesn't know I'm living with a straight woman. I don't want to get her hopes up.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: All right. Bye, buddy. Bye, bye, bye!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh, my goodness.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in bullhorn] Pull over!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Move to the side of the road!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pull over!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What do you--Dwight! [Dwight cuts her off in his car, they pull over]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [getting out of her car] Dwight! What the [bleep] is your problem!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on bullhorn still] Shut up, woman!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Who drives like that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Listen to me! I love you! And I don't care that Phillip's not my son. I will raise 100 children with 100 of your lovers if it means that I can be with you!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can you put that down?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This expresses how loudly I love you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's too loud.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [puts down bullhorn and kneels] This is a ring, taken from the buttocks of my grandmother, put there by the gangster patriarch of the Coors dynasty, melted in a foundry run by Mennonites.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay, yes--yes, I will! [they kiss] I love you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I love you!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: And I lied to you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phillip's your son.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Why would you say that--

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I just needed you to want to marry me because you wanted to marry me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [excited] Get out! I'm a dad!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're a dad!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Hey, grab a seat. We have that table and that table, but not that table or that table or that table. Floor's up for grabs. Meredith has been hogging the can. [Dwight kisses Creed's head] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You have to change the channel to PBS.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: College baseball is on.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: But there's a documentary coming up. Everyone in the bar will love it.

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: What's it about?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: A paper company.

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: How many people want the game? [half the bar cheers] Who wants PBS? [other half cheers] Sorry. Tie means I do nothing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Sir, please. This show is about me and my attempts to find love in all the wrong places.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: One more for the doc. [the office staff cheers]

quotes.speaker: Bartender
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Hey, how was the singing show audition?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh. Eh, whatever. No big deal.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Ok, thirty seconds to showtime!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I feel scared a little.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm not ready for this.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: No one is ready for this. You can't be ready for this. We don't even know what this is.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: One thing we do know, nothing will ever be the same.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here we go. [documentary starts with the first scene of "Pilot"]
